borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<div>The proposed development by reason of its scale, siting and design, depth, massing and bulk would negatively affect neighbouring amenities. The first floor side extension and ground floor rear extension would create an overbearing outlook towards adjoining neighbours. The ground floor rear extension and first floor side extension will result in significant levels of overshadowing and loss of daylight to the adjoining neighbours to the west and east. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:</div><div><br></div><div><p><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">-
National Planning Policy Framework </span>National Planning Policy Framework
(NPPF) (DLUHC, 2023)<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; line-height: 107%; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- Policy D4 of the
London Plan (March 2021)</span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; line-height: 107%; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- The Residential
Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal">









</p><p><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">-
Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of </span>The London Borough of Barking and
Dagenham’s Local Plan: (September, 2024)<o:p></o:p></p></div>
description: Construction of a front porch, a first floor side extension, a part two storey part single storey rear extension and conversion of existing garage into a habitable space
